meanings.definition: To dismiss from a job or position.
meanings.sent1: The company had to dehire some employees due to budget cuts.
meanings.sent2: After the project was completed, they decided to dehire the temporary workers.
meanings.sent3: It was a sad day when they had to dehire the office manager who had been with the company for years.
meanings.sent4: The decision to dehire the team captain was like removing the heart of the team.
meanings.sent5: The boss's choice to dehire the lazy worker was a wake-up call for everyone else.

meanings.sent1: The restaurant had to dehire some staff members during the slow season.
meanings.sent2: She felt relieved when they finally dehired her from the stressful job.
meanings.sent3: The magician decided to dehire his assistant after she kept messing up the tricks.
meanings.sent4: Being dehired from the company felt like being set free from a cage.
meanings.sent5: The decision to dehire the unreliable employee was a weight off the manager's shoulders.

meanings.definition: To terminate a contract or agreement.
meanings.sent1: The company had to dehire the contractor due to breach of contract.
meanings.sent2: They decided to dehire the service provider after multiple complaints from customers.
meanings.sent3: The decision to dehire the supplier was met with mixed reactions from the team.
meanings.sent4: The choice to dehire the vendor was like cutting ties with an unreliable partner.
meanings.sent5: The board's vote to dehire the consultant was a bold move towards a new direction.
